descriptions: The student demonstrates no experimentation with self-identified stimuli for movement.
The student attempts to experiment with stimuli but struggles to translate ideas into movement.
The student identifies and experiments with stimuli, but the connection to movement is superficial or unclear.
The student effectively experiments with a variety of self-identified stimuli (e.g., music/sound, text, objects) and begins to translate concepts into movement.
The student skillfully experiments with a range of stimuli, demonstrating clear connections between the stimuli and the resulting movement phrases.
The student innovatively experiments with diverse stimuli, pushing boundaries and creating highly expressive movement that reflects a deep understanding of the source material.
The student does not engage with the given movement problem or offer any solutions.
The student attempts to address the movement problem but struggles to find a viable solution.
The student explores the movement problem and offers a basic solution, but lacks clarity or development.
The student explores the given movement problem and selects a reasonable solution, demonstrating some understanding of the challenge.
The student thoughtfully explores the movement problem, selecting and demonstrating a well-developed and effective solution.
The student creatively and comprehensively explores the movement problem, devising an innovative and highly effective solution that showcases artistic expression.
